articles.title: Delayed justice plagues India. The 16th Finance Commission has the power to improve matters
articles.summary: The clocks of justice in India tick much slower than any citizen would hope. At the time of writing this article, 5.22 crore cases are pending across all levels of courts in India. Quasi-judicial bodies like the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) and the Central Administrative Tribunal (CAT) also have large backlogs.

articles.summary: Delhi High Court held that the Initiating Officer has given reasons to believe as to how petitioner is a Benamidar. Further, writ is not admitted as petitioner has an efficacious remedy before Adjudicating Officer under Section 26 of the Benami Act. articles.summary: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), the municipal corporation of Bengaluru city, till recently, managed core urban municipal functions in Bengaluru, including property tax administration, building regulations, and licensing. It is no surprise that their work generates a steady stream of disputes between them and residents, businesses, and employees.

articles.title: The missing piece in India’s reform story—a strong tribunal system

articles.title: Budget 2026: Smarter import duties can do the heavy lifting for manufacturing, says Deloitte India
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: Deloitte India suggests rationalising import duties and increasing budget allocations to boost domestic manufacturing and exports. Reforms to the SEZ regime, including duty-free domestic supply and easing sub-contracting, are also recommended to improve competitiveness. The consulting firm advocates for broadening the Phased Manufacturing Program and enhancing the Market Access Initiative to strengthen export promotion.

articles.title: Budget 2026 can build a Viksit Bharat powerhouse on farms, youth & middle class
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026–27 is expected to focus on turning the Viksit Bharat vision into reality by prioritising agriculture, youth and the middle class. With strong growth projections, the government is likely to push investments in farming, skills, jobs and infrastructure while offering targeted relief to support long-term development.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026 likely to set 9% growth target for next year, increase capex to Rs 12-12.2 lakh crores: BoB economist
articles.summary: The Union Budget 2026 is set to target 8.5-9% economic growth. Capital expenditure will see a significant increase. The budget will prioritise MSMEs and export-oriented sectors. Measures to ease compliance and potentially reduce customs duties are expected.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Sustaining India’s growth depends on consumption, investment, and fiscal consolidation
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: As we move into 2026, India's economic landscape is flourishing with notable strides in both manufacturing and services. The dual engine of rising private consumption and investment is propelling this success, leading experts to amend their growth predictions positively.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026 to be presented on February 1, Sunday
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present the Union Budget on February 1, 2026. Parliament will convene for the Budget session on January 28, 2026. The session will conclude on April 2, 2026. The President will address a joint sitting on the opening day. This marks a significant event for the nation's financial planning.

articles.title: Trump says if Supreme Court strikes down his tariffs: 'WE'RE SCREWED!'
articles.summary: President Donald Trump warns Supreme Court ruling against his tariff powers could make US refunds nearly impossible, calling potential repayments a complete mess and posting concerns on social media.

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg-led Meta, WhatsApp move Supreme Court against CCI ruling
articles.summary: Meta and WhatsApp have approached the Supreme Court to challenge the CCI order accusing them of abusing dominant position, upholding ₹213 crore penalty and data-sharing restrictions.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026 to be presented at 11 am on February 1, Lok Sabha speaker confirms
articles.summary: Nirmala Sitharaman will present the Union Budget 2026 at 11 am on February 1, Sunday, marking her ninth consecutive Budget in Lok Sabha, outlining fiscal priorities for the next year.

articles.title: India's forex reserves drop by $9.80 billion to $686.80 billion
articles.summary: India's forex reserves fell by $9.809 billion to $686.801 billion as of January 2, with declines in foreign currency assets, gold reserves, SDRs, and IMF reserve position, RBI reported.

articles.summary: EY India urges Union Budget 2026 to focus on tax certainty, sector-led investments, PLI extension, dispute resolution, and reforms to boost private capital, innovation and global competitiveness.

articles.title: Trump threat of 25% tariff on countries doing business with Iran presents a dilemma for India
articles.summary: President Trump has imposed a new 25% tariff on countries trading with Iran, effective immediately. For India, this adds to existing levies, potentially raising total US tariffs on Indian goods to 75%. The move threatens a $2.33 billion trade relationship and strategic ties, such as Chabahar Port.

articles.title: Bombay HC Quashed GST Demand for Treating Leasehold Assignment as Supply of Service
articles.summary: The Bombay High Court held that assignment of long-term leasehold rights in immovable property does not constitute a supply of services under the GST law. The Court quashed the GST demand, ruling that such transfers fall outside the scope of taxable supply. The post Bombay HC Quashed GST Demand for Treating Leasehold Assignment as Supply of Service appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: MP Cabinet approves implementation of space tech policy 2026
articles.summary: The policy will promote innovation in satellite manufacturing, geospatial analysis, and downstream applications. Over the next five years, the policy is expected to attract Rs 1,000 crore investment and generate approximately 8,000 jobs, with an estimated financial implication of Rs 628 crore.

articles.title: India may tweak e-car manufacturing SOP scheme to woo global firms
articles.summary: Officials are evaluating changes to the Scheme to Promote Manufacturing of Electric Passenger Cars in India (SPMEPCI), which relies primarily on import duty concessions, including the introduction of more direct incentives, to entice global premium EV makers to establish manufacturing bases in India.

articles.title: Germany's Merz heads to India to bolster trade, security ties
articles.summary: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz is in India to boost economic and security ties. This visit comes ahead of a planned EU-India free trade agreement. Discussions will cover trade, defense deals, and skilled labor recruitment. India seeks broader partnerships to reduce dependence on other nations. German companies see significant opportunities in India's growing market.

articles.title: 2025: A milestone in India-Singapore relations
articles.summary: India and Singapore marked 60 years of diplomatic relations in 2025. High-level visits by leaders from both nations strengthened their Comprehensive Strategic Partnership. A roadmap was unveiled to deepen trade and market access. Defence cooperation saw significant engagements, including maritime exercises. Various ministerial and parliamentary delegations also exchanged visits, underscoring the robust bilateral ties.

articles.title: KRBL says Iran exposure is lower now, but US tariffs hurt basmati prices
articles.summary: Indian rice exporters are facing new risks after the US warned of a 25% tariff on countries trading with Iran. KRBL said its current exposure to Iran is $8–10 million, down from about $100 million in 2018. Industry data shows Iran remains the second largest buyer of Indian basmati rice, with exports of $470 million so far this year. Exporters report falling domestic prices and over ₹2,000 crore in delayed payments due to disruptions inside Iran.

articles.summary: Fund managers said IPO valuations in India are becoming more reasonable, but stock markets are likely to stay in a consolidation phase until valuations move closer to long-term averages. Chirag Setalvad of HDFC AMC said global factors will remain key for market direction. articles.title: Budget 2026: FICCI pushes for strenghtening 'Atmanirbharta' in defence, critical minerals
articles.summary: Industry body FICCI has presented its Union Budget 2026 recommendations. The focus is on strengthening self-reliance in defence, electronics manufacturing, and critical minerals. Increased allocations for defence, support for drone technology, and a push for exports are key proposals. The budget is expected to drive indigenous development and reduce import dependency across vital sectors.

articles.title: Debt funds face December blues as investors pull out for liquidity
articles.summary: Debt mutual fund AUM fell 6.5% in December as advance tax-related redemptions triggered sharp outflows, particularly in short-term categories. Despite an RBI rate cut, rising bond supply pushed yields higher, keeping investors cautious on duration strategies. Analysts say redemptions were largely tactical, driven by liquidity needs rather than credit concerns.

articles.title: Made in India, but taxed like an import: Industry pushes for SEZ duty relief
articles.summary: Industry and policy experts are divided over whether easing customs duties on SEZ domestic clearances will strengthen India’s manufacturing ecosystem or undermine tariff parity, as the debate resurfaces ahead of the Union Budget 2026.

articles.title: Telecom operators seek Budget relief, propose cut in licence fees and GST waivers

articles.summary: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar held discussions with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, covering trade, critical minerals, nuclear cooperation, defense, and energy. Both leaders agreed to maintain ongoing contact on these vital bilateral issues.

articles.title: Trump’s 25% duty on Iran-linked trade rattles exporters
articles.summary: Indian exporters await clarity on US President Donald Trump's new 25% tariff on trade with Iran. This move could impact India's trade relations with Iran. Indian firms are compliant with existing sanctions, focusing on humanitarian trade. The full impact will be known after official notification.

articles.title: India can’t shake Iran’s ghosts as Trump opens new box of worries
articles.summary: US President Donald Trump announced a 25% tariff on goods from countries “doing business” with Iran, effective immediately, escalating pressure on Tehran amid widespread protests. The move could impact India, historically among Iran’s top five trade partners.

articles.title: India-EU trade deal in ‘final stages’; talks with US underway, says Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: India is nearing a trade agreement with the European Union. Talks are also underway for a trade deal with the United States. These developments signal significant progress in India's international trade relations. The India-EU agreement aims for completion soon. The European Union is India's largest trading partner in goods. This indicates a strengthening economic partnership.

articles.title: Bitcoin retreats to $90,000 after failing to hold $92,000 on Trump’s tariff announcement
articles.summary: Bitcoin retreated toward $90,000 after failing to sustain levels above $92,000 following Donald Trump’s announcement of a 25% tariff on countries trading with Iran. Geopolitical concerns, safe-haven rallies in gold and silver, and over $650 million in ETF outflows weighed on sentiment, keeping BTC and ETH locked in a tight range.

articles.title: Donald Trump announces 25% tariff on any country doing business with Iran effective immediately
articles.summary: The new tariff announcement also comes ahead of the Supreme Court ruling on whether or not Trump's tariffs even pass the legal framework. The Supreme Court has scheduled the next "opinion day" on Wednesday.

articles.title: India–US trade deal: Tariffs remain the key hurdle, not Modi–Trump talks, says former assistant USTR
articles.summary: Differing assessments from US and Indian trade experts suggest that domestic political considerations in Washington and unresolved tariff levels, rather than gaps in negotiations, are keeping the India-US trade agreement on hold, even as official talks are said to be largely complete.

articles.title: US-India trade deal didn't happen because PM Modi didn't call President Trump, claims Lutnick

articles.summary: Missing the Income Tax Return filing deadline doesn’t end your tax obligation, but it can make it more expensive and restrictive. From late filing fees and interest charges to limits on refunds and loss carry-forward, this photo story breaks down what changes when you file late and why timing matters as much as accuracy.

articles.title: Indian government is mapping out more public fast chargers but implementation remains slow
articles.summary: Under the PM E-DRIVE scheme, the government has a budget outlay of Rs 10,900 crore to focus on setting up fast chargers for vehicle categories.

articles.title: India's inflation rate stays low at 1.33%, leaves room for another RBI repo rate cut
articles.summary: India's benign inflation and high GDP growth prompted the RBI to cut repo rate by 25 basis points last month.

articles.summary: External affairs minister S Jaishankar held a productive discussion with US secretary of state Marco Rubio, covering key bilateral and strategic areas. articles.summary: A Communist Party of China delegation's visit to New Delhi has ignited a political firestorm, with the Congress and BJP trading barbs over transparency and India's China policy. सीसीआई ने क्रिसकैपिटल फंड एक्स, टू इन्फिनिटी पार्टनर्स और ब्लू वेव इन्वेस्टमेंट्स लिमिटेड द्वारा सामूहिक रूप से नैश इंडस्ट्रीज (आई) प्राइवेट लिमिटेड में कुछ इक्विटी शेयर पूंजी के अधिग्रहण को मंजूरी दे दी है

उपराष्ट्रपति श्री सीपी राधाकृष्णन 14 से 15 जनवरी, 2026 तक तमिलनाडु के दौरे पर रहेंगे

The political and economic importance of such projects also influences legal standards, regulatory practice

articles.title: TREADS: Transboundary Rivers, Ecologies & Development Studies
articles.summary: TREADS programme encompasses and echoes our research and policy interests in transboundary political ecologies, river water governance and development studies. We are interested in politics and ecologies (relationships) across boundaries – after Neil Smith’s “markers of difference” – at different scales. We pursue our interests in this generic sense of transboundary political spaces, at present focused primarily on transboundary river water governance.

articles.title: State Capacity Initiative
articles.summary: The State Capacity Initiative at CPR is an interdisciplinary research and practice programme focused on addressing the challenges of the 21st-century Indian state. The purpose of this initiative is to place the critical challenges of building state capacity at the heart of the field of policy research in India, where it has always belonged but remains surprisingly marginalised. We therefore start with first principles and ground ourselves in existing realities to deepen and expand the understand

articles.title: Scaling City Institutions for India Initiative (SCI-FI)
articles.summary: The Scaling City Institutions for India (SCI-FI) programme aims to better understand ‘governance scale’ in Indian cities in tandem with ‘sector specific socio-economic scales’. Through research, the programme aims to inform stakeholders, including the three tiers of the government, to develop better informed policies and programmes enabling improved governance and service delivery. It has two key thematic focus in areas of Land, Housing and Planning, and Water and Sanitation. The SCI-FI programm

These vulnerable groups rely solely on land and the environment for sustenance. However, underneath

She highlights the unpopularity of civil courts, the systemic nature of the problem and argues that real change lies not in blaming individuals but in pursuing institutional reforms to strengthen our civil courts.

articles.title: Mapping Judicial Time: A Two-by-Two Framework for Categorising Listings
articles.summary: In this blog post, Gokul Krishnan R proposes a novel two-by-two framework for categorising case listings in Indian trial courts. The framework classifies listings based on their nature (procedural or substantive) and their effectiveness in advancing cases toward resolution. This approach provides a nuanced understanding of judicial time utilisation, moving beyond traditional definitions of "effective hearing".

articles.summary: The visit to Petwar, part of CJI’s two-day official programme in Hisar and Hansi districts of Haryana, witnessed unprecedented public celebration in the small agrarian village.

articles.title: ‘In rooms smaller than bathrooms, one person handles workload of 3’: Inside Saket court’s staffing crisis
articles.summary: Harish Singh Mahar, a 43-year-old ahlmad at the district court, jumped to his death from the fifth floor of the complex. His death triggered protests by other court employees.

articles.title: From Pragya Thakur acquittal to Governors’ powers, what legal experts think of landmark verdicts of 2025
articles.summary: Panellists at the event organised by Think India forum included Attorney General R. Venkataramani, Delhi HC judge Saurabh Banerjee, and ASG Archana Pathak Dave.

articles.title: At Hansi homecoming, CJI Surya Kant recalls childhood bicycle rides & watching his first film
articles.summary: Chief Justice of India Surya Kant visits his home town Hansi in Haryana for the first time since his elevation.

articles.title: Air purifier PIL in Delhi HC: Centre assures it will review house panel report advising GST cut
articles.summary: As Delhi-NCR struggles with deteriorating air quality, Centre says it will examine a parliamentary standing committee's advice to reduce or scrap GST on air purifiers.

articles.title: ‘No evidence, 2 no-shows’: 2nd clean chit for Rocky Mittal & Haryana BJP chief Badoli in gang rape case
articles.summary: A Himachal Pradesh court accepts police closure report for second time, ending proceedings in gang-rape case against Haryana BJP chief and singer Rocky Mittal. Police cited lack of evidence.

articles.title: Friday blockbuster: Nail-biter that played out in Madras HC over Vijay’s movie ‘Jana Nayagan’
articles.summary: Originally scheduled for Friday, the movie's release was stalled following a complaint alleging that certain portions hurt religious sentiments.

articles.title: ‘Pre-bifurcation govt orders valid until repealed’: Inside SC’s revival of decade-old Andhra graft FIRs
articles.summary: SC observed that Andhra Pradesh High Court had taken a ‘hyper-technical approach’ while quashing FIRs against public servants registered post reorganisation of state in 2014.

articles.title: Why Delhi private schools are opposing new fee regulation law & how it’s playing out in high court
articles.summary: ThePrint explains what’s in the new fee regulation law, what is the case in the Delhi High Court, who will be part of these fee regulation committees and how they will function.

articles.title: SC gives Justice Varma time till Monday to file response before LS probe panel in cash recovery row
articles.summary: The judge sought extension after SC concluded hearing on his petition challenging formation of the panel, and reserved the verdict. The bench declined his request for extension.

articles.title: China limits Nvidia chip purchases to special circumstances: Report
articles.summary: The Chinese government this week told some ‍tech companies it ​would only approve their purchases of Nvidia's ⁠H200 AI chips under special circumstances, such as for university research, the Information reported on Tuesday, citing two people with ‌direct knowledge ‌of the situation.

articles.title: Britain seeks 'reset' in copyright battle between AI and creators
articles.summary: British technology minister Liz Kendall said on Tuesday the ‍government was seeking a "reset" on ​plans to overhaul copyright rules to accommodate artificial intelligence, ⁠pledging to protect creators while unlocking AI's economic potential.

articles.title: Musk vs OpenAI trial set for April 27: US court
articles.summary: The US court has scheduled the trial between Elon Musk and OpenAI for April 27.

articles.title: Eternal says no material change to Blinkit business as quick commerce firm drops 10-minute delivery branding
articles.summary: Responding to a notice by the exchanges following the government asking platforms to discontinue 10-minute delivery branding, Eternal said in a filing that there was no change to its quick commerce business model that could have any material impact on the company.

articles.title: Polygon targets stablecoin payments with deals worth $250 million
articles.summary: Blockchain firm Polygon Labs said on Tuesday it would ‍buy crypto payments company ​Coinme and crypto infrastructure provider Sequence for ⁠more than $250 million, as it looks to tap the growing demand for stablecoin-based transactions.

articles.title: Fintech firm PayU Payments' loss narrows to Rs 248 crore in FY25
articles.summary: Fintech firm PayU Payments has reported a narrowing of loss to Rs 248 crore in the financial year 2024-25, according to a regulatory document shared by market intelligence firm Tofler on Tuesday.

articles.title: Britain takes to TikTok to highlight immigration raids
articles.summary: Britain's government has launched a TikTok account showing raids on migrants ‍accused of working illegally, with the ​aim of convincing voters and potential new arrivals that it is tackling ⁠what many see as Britain's most pressing problem: immigration.

articles.title: X down for thousands of users globally, Downdetector shows
articles.summary: There ‌were ‌more than 22,900 reports of ‌issues with the platform in the US as of 9:19 am ET, according to Downdetector, ​which tracks ​outages by collating status ‌reports from ‍a number of ‍sources.

articles.title: PFRDA pushing pension adoption among private employees, says chairman
articles.summary: The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) aims to expand pension coverage to private sector employees, beyond its traditional government base, said its chairman S Ramann. It is focusing on improving distribution and offering flexible products to suit different incomes. PB Fintech founder Yashish Dahiya said that the company plans to invest in its pension business.

articles.title: Microsoft president pushes Big Tech to 'pay our way' for AI data centres amid rising opposition
articles.summary: As Big Tech expands into AI, it encounters significant pushback from communities worried about the impacts on local power grids and water supplies. Microsoft's top executive, Brad Smith, is calling on government officials to push for infrastructure investment from tech companies instead of passing the costs onto taxpayers.

articles.title: Social media harms teens, watchdog warns, as France weighs ban
articles.summary: Social media harms the mental health of adolescents, particularly girls, France's health watchdog said Tuesday as the country debates banning children under 15 from accessing the immensely popular platforms. France is currently debating two bills, one backed by President Emmanuel Macron, that would ban social media for under 15s.

articles.title: 'Are you dead?': Chinese app for solo dwellers goes viral
articles.summary: A new app, 'Are You Dead?', is topping sales charts in China. It alerts emergency contacts if users do not check in every 48 hours. This safety tool is designed for China's growing population of people living alone.

articles.title: Uber invests in CarDekho-backed fleet management startup Carrum
articles.summary: Uber has made a strategic investment in Gurugram-based fleet operator Carrum, though financial details were not disclosed. The startup will use the funding to expand its clean mobility fleet and enter more cities. Carrum, backed by CarDekho Group, currently operates over 3,000 CNG vehicles and partners closely with Uber across major urban markets.

articles.title: Govt asks quick commerce platforms to drop '10-minute delivery' branding
articles.summary: The labour minister has asked quick commerce firms to stop advertising 10-minute deliveries, citing worker safety. Platforms have agreed to drop the branding, though operations will continue largely unchanged. The move follows gig-worker strikes and wider concerns that ultra-fast promises create pressure, despite the sector’s rapid growth in Indian cities nationwide.

articles.title: Google to develop, manufacture smartphones in Vietnam, Nikkei Asia says
articles.summary: Google ‍will begin ‍new product introductions (NPI) for its ‌Pixel, Pixel Pro and Pixel Fold phones in Vietnam, with ‍development of the lower-end ‍Pixel A ⁠series ⁠remaining in China for now.

articles.title: Blinkit removes '10-minute delivery' claim on govt's orders; Swiggy, Zepto may follow suit
articles.summary: Blinkit has removed its '10-minute' delivery promise across all platforms following intervention by the Union Ministry of Labour. This move comes after a nationwide gig worker strike on New Year's Eve 2025, which highlighted concerns over delivery personnel's health, safety, and income.

articles.title: Google parent joins elite $4-trillion market cap club
articles.summary: The company's shares rose as much as 1.7% to $334.04 after news broke that Apple and Google had entered a multi-year deal for Gemini models to power the next generation of the former’s virtual assistant, Siri. The announcement cemented Alphabet as Wall Street's second-most valuable company, surpassing Apple for the first time since 2019.

articles.title: Elon Musk calls AI tie‑up with Apple ‘unreasonable concentration of power for Google’
articles.summary: Apple has chosen Google’s Gemini models and cloud infrastructure to power its future foundation models Under this partnership, Gemini will power Apple Intelligence features, including a more personalised Siri, expected to launch this year as part of iOS 26.4, likely in March or April.

articles.title: Trump says Microsoft to make changes to curb data center power costs for Americans
articles.summary: "I never want Americans to pay ‌higher Electricity bills because of Data Centers. Therefore, my Administration is working with major American Technology ‍Companies to secure their commitment to ‍the American ⁠People, ⁠and we will have much to announce in the coming weeks," Trump said on social media.

articles.title: Brazil's antitrust body opens investigation into WhatsApp business tool
articles.summary: In ‌a statement, CADE said that there are potential anti-competitive practices arising from ‍the new terms regarding ‍the access ⁠and ⁠offering by artificial intelligence tool providers of their technologies to WhatsApp users.

articles.title: SK Hynix to invest nearly $13 billion in chip packaging plant in South Korea
articles.summary: SK Hynix said ​accelerating global competition in AI is driving ‌a ‍sharp rise in demand for ‍AI-focused memory, underscoring the need to respond ‌proactively to growing demand for high-bandwidth memory (HBM) chips.

articles.title: Pentagon is embracing Musk's Grok AI chatbot as it draws global outcry
articles.summary: The announcement comes just days after Grok - which is embedded into X, the social media network owned by Musk - drew global outcry and scrutiny for generating highly sexualized deepfake images of people without their consent.

articles.title: Nvidia says no upfront payment needed for its H200 chips
articles.summary: The company said it "would never require customers ‌to pay ‌for products they do not receive", in a response ‌to a Reuters story on January 8 about the company having imposed unusually stringent terms requiring full upfront payment from Chinese customers seeking ​its artificial intelligence chips.

articles.title: Tier-II GCCs grapple with longer senior hiring cycles
articles.summary: Global Capability Centres (GCCs) are shifting senior technology roles back to metro hubs from Tier-II cities and adopting hybrid hiring models to cope with a severe talent crunch. Smaller cities are currently taking more than 75 days to fill leadership positions, compared with 42-56 days in the metros, staffing firms told ET.

articles.title: ISRO's rocket encounters anomaly; loses 16 satellites in first mission of 2026
articles.summary: This is the second consecutive setback for the PSLV in eight months. Earlier, in May this year, PSLV-C61 failed to place the EOS-09 earth observation satellite into orbit due to a third-stage anomaly. Meanwhile, startups and industry experts have repeatedly flagged delays in launch schedules and limited access to testing facilities, prompting some firms to explore overseas launch options.

articles.title: India much higher than US from growth perspective, says top Bosch executive
articles.summary: For German manufacturing giant Bosch, India is emerging as a key development base for its artificial intelligence-related technology innovations in smart mobility and industrial manufacturing. The company, which earlier this year committed to investing $2.9 billion in AI-related innovations, is looking at India as a key software hub for all its global business developments. The country houses more than 20,000 of Bosch’s 38,000 software developers.

articles.title: Meta to build gigawatt-scale computing capacity under Meta Compute effort
articles.summary: ​Meta will ⁠establish Meta ‌Compute ‌to ‌construct tens of gigawatts of ​computing ​infrastructure ‌this ‍decade ‍and hundreds of gigawatts ‌more in the ‍future, CEO ‍Mark ⁠Zuckerberg ⁠said on Monday.

articles.title: UK to accelerate law criminalising creation of sexual deepfakes
articles.summary: ​Britain will bring into effect ⁠a law criminalising the creation of non-consensual intimate images this week, ‌technology ‌minister Liz Kendall told parliament on Monday ‌after regulator Ofcom launched an investigation into Elon Musk's X.

articles.title: Meta to exclude Italy from rival chatbot ban on WhatsApp
articles.summary: Meta Platforms will exclude Italy from its ‍ban on rival AI chatbots ​on WhatsApp following an order from the country's antitrust authority, ⁠according to a notice sent to AI providers and developers.

articles.title: Italy antitrust cuts Amazon record fine to $878 million
articles.summary: Italy's ​antitrust authority said ⁠on Monday it had reduced ‌a ‌record fine imposed ‌on US ecommerce giant Amazon to 752.4 million ​euros ($878.20 million) from ​an original ‌amount ‍of 1.128 ‍billion euros.

articles.title: Alphabet hits $4 trillion valuation as AI refocus lifts sentiment
articles.summary: Alphabet hit a $4 trillion market valuation on Monday, as the Google parent's ‍sharpened artificial intelligence focus allayed ​doubts about its strategy and thrust it back to ⁠the forefront of the high-stakes race.

articles.title: Nvidia, Eli Lilly to spend $1 billion over five years on joint research lab
articles.summary: Nvidia and US pharma giant ‍Eli Lilly will spend $1 ​billion building a new joint research lab in ⁠the San Francisco Bay area over five years which will use Nvidia's newest generation Vera Rubin AI chips, the firms said on Monday.

articles.title: Ola Electric enters residential energy storage with Shakti rollout, diversifies beyond EVs
articles.summary: Shakti, announced earlier by founder Bhavish Aggarwal, is powered by Ola Electric’s indigenously developed 4680 Bharat Cell and is positioned as a residential and small commercial energy storage solution.

articles.title: Meta appoints former Trump adviser Dina Powell as president and vice chair
articles.summary: Dina Powell McCormick, who has worked with both US President Donald Trump and former President George W Bush, is expected to join Meta’s management team, where she will work closely with its compute and infrastructure teams to oversee large-scale, multi-billion-dollar investments in data centres, energy systems, and global connectivity.

articles.title: Shadowfax to launch IPO next week at Rs 7,400-crore valuation: Sources
articles.summary: Shadowfax, a Flipkart-backed logistics firm, is set to launch its IPO next week at a lower-than-expected valuation of around Rs 7,400 crore. The company aims to raise Rs 1,900 crore, partly to expand its network and partly for brand-building. Shadowfax has posted strong revenue and profit growth in recent years.

articles.title: Govt refutes Reuters report on demanding source code from Apple, Samsung
articles.summary: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has said that a Reuters report which claims the union government has demanded that smartphone makers share their source code is false. The report also stated that firms like Apple and Samsung have to implement software changes due to the government’s security concerns.

articles.title: HCL Technologies Q3 Results: Cons PAT falls 11% YoY to Rs 4,076 crore, revenue rises 13%; Rs 12 per share dividend declared
articles.summary: HCL Tech Q3 Results: HCL Technologies on Monday reported an 11% YoY fall in its December quarter consolidated net profit at Rs 4,076 crore compared to Rs 4,591 crore reported in the year ago period. The profit after tax (PAT) is attributable to the owners of the company.

articles.title: Infra.Market FY25 revenue jumps 27% to Rs 18,472 crore, profit falls 42%
articles.summary: Infra.Market reported strong topline growth in FY25, with revenue rising sharply year-on-year, even as profitability weakened. Higher costs across materials, staffing and finance dragged net profit down significantly. The Mumbai-based construction materials platform has filed confidentially for a Rs 5,000-crore IPO and was last valued at about $2.8 billion.

articles.title: TCS Q3 Results: Cons PAT falls 14% YoY to Rs 10,657 crore, but revenue rises 5%
articles.summary: TCS Q3 Results: Revenue from operations in Q3FY26 rose 5% year-on-year to Rs 67,087 crore, up from Rs 63,973 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous financial year.

articles.title: India to be invited to join US-led AI initiative
articles.summary: India will be invited next month to join a new US-led initiative aimed at securing AI supply chains, the new US ambassador to New Delhi said Monday. Dubbed the "Pax Silica", after the Latin terms for peace and silicon, the alliance aims to secure supply chains of key components independent of China.

articles.title: Demand for AI, tech experts pushes UK financial sector vacancies up 12%, recruiter says
articles.summary: The year-on-year increase happened despite a slowdown in the fourth quarter, as volatility in global markets and uncertainty about the government's November ​budget prompted caution in hiring ​managers, Morgan McKinley's London Employment Monitor, ‌a ‍quarterly survey of financial services vacancies, ‍showed.

articles.title: Account suspended: X shelves iconic @twitter handle
articles.summary: Users who attempt to access the @Twitter handle are now greeted with the message "Account Suspended", noting that the account violated X's rules. Screenshots popped up late Friday, with memes and jokes about the platform policing its own past.

articles.title: What the Grok controversy reveals about NSFW content from AI chatbots
articles.summary: Grok is facing serious scrutiny after previously enabling users to generate sexually explicit visual content involving real individuals, raising concerns around personal safety, dignity, privacy, and consent. While Elon Musk-owned xAI has since rolled back access, restricting image and video generation to its paid subscribers, the incident has sparked a larger question about AI chatbots generating sexually explicit content.

articles.title: Zepto claims Hyderabad accident victim was not its delivery partner
articles.summary: The incident occurred in the city's Mehdipatnam police limits, where a rider named Abhishek, a native of Shekpet, died after his two-wheeler collided with a bus. Police officials said that the victim worked as a delivery rider for Zepto, prompting the Gig Workers’ Union to demand justice and compensation for the family.

articles.title: Meta urges Australia to change teen social media ban
articles.summary: Tech giant Meta urged Australia on Monday to rethink its world-first social media ban for under-16s, while reporting that it has blocked more than 544,000 accounts under the new law. Australia has required big platforms including Meta, TikTok and YouTube to stop underage users from holding accounts since the legislation came into force on December 10 last year.

articles.title: Google's Gemini seeks edge in AI for online shopping
articles.summary: Google on Sunday unveiled a new iteration of its professional Gemini AI suite geared toward online retail, seeking to create seamless interactions for shoppers from product searches to customer service. Walmart said the tool would help it offer products best suited to its customers' needs, more regularly converting product searches into sales.

articles.title: Mixed Q3 awaits Indian ER&D companies navigating auto sector headwinds
articles.summary: Indian engineering service firms like Tata Elxsi, KPIT and LTTS are set for a mixed Q3 due to weak auto demand, though rising R D in EVs and hybrids offers support. Analysts expect modest 1–2.8% revenue growth, with EU-focused companies benefiting more than US-exposed peers. These firms' FY26 growth could reach 15–20%.

articles.title: Economic growth strongest, most sustainable form of financial inclusion: CEA
articles.summary: Economic growth is the most sustainable form of financial inclusion, Chief Economic Adviser V Anantha Nageswaran stated. He emphasized that when economies generate jobs and demand, people naturally enter the financial system. True inclusion enables individuals to move from survival to economic independence, not just account activation.

articles.title: US tariff on Iran partners to have minimal impact on India: Govt sources
articles.summary: India's trade with Iran is minimal, representing a small fraction of its total commerce. Recent US tariff announcements targeting countries doing business with Iran are not expected to significantly affect India's economic engagement. Indian exporters remain watchful but composed. Trade with Iran is projected to decline further due to external economic factors.

articles.title: India to grow 7.2% in FY26: World Bank
articles.summary: The World Bank has upgraded India's FY26 growth forecast to 7.2%, driven by robust domestic demand and rising rural incomes. While FY27 growth is projected to moderate to 6.5% due to US tariffs, it's expected to rebound to 6.6% in FY28. South Asia's growth is anticipated to rise to 7.1% in 2025, largely due to India's strong economic performance.

articles.title: Trump to attend WEF Davos meet; strong India delegation expected
articles.summary: US President Donald Trump will lead a large delegation to the World Economic Forum in Davos, alongside leaders from G-7 nations, China, and Pakistan. The five-day meeting, beginning January 18, will focus on Ukraine, Gaza, and Latin America, with a strong Indian presence including four Union ministers and six chief ministers.

articles.title: RBI proposes resumption of licensing of urban co-op banks
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India is considering reissuing licenses for Urban Cooperative Banks after a two-decade pause. A discussion paper has been released, inviting feedback on resuming licensing and eligibility criteria. A key proposal includes a minimum capital requirement of Rs 300 crore for new UCBs. This move aims to strengthen the cooperative banking sector.

articles.title: India's December vegetable oil imports rise 8 pc: SEA data
articles.summary: India's vegetable oil imports saw an eight percent jump in December 2025. This rise was driven by higher shipments of soyabean and sunflower oils. Despite this monthly increase, total imports for the first two months of the oil year are down. Palm oil imports declined, while crude palm oil and sunflower oil saw significant gains.

articles.title: Central govt capex likely to slow in rest of FY26 as spending front-loaded in first half: Morgan Stanley
articles.summary: The central government's capital expenditure (capex) is expected to slow in the remaining part of FY26 as a large part of the spending was front-loaded in the first half of the fiscal year, highlighted a report by Morgan Stanley.

articles.title: India dismisses claims of suspending trade with Afghanistan
articles.summary: India has refuted claims circulating on Pakistani social media. These reports falsely suggested a suspension of trade with Afghanistan. The government stated that a fabricated letter is being shared by propaganda accounts. India's trade figures with Afghanistan for 2024-25 show significant export and import values.

articles.title: India’s growth trajectory setting the stage for Budget 2026
articles.summary: Union Budget: India's economy is experiencing strong momentum ahead of Budget 2026, driven by robust consumption, favorable monsoons, and government spending. Reforms like GST 2.0 and export liberalization, alongside R D incentives, are poised to further stimulate growth and position India as a global hub for high-value services.

articles.title: India-EU FTA: Importance, benefit for India's foreign trade & other key specifics | An explainer
articles.summary: India-EU FTA: Tariffs or import duties are either reduced or eliminated under an FTA. Therefore, an FTA will open markets, align regulations between the two, and benefit key industries like technology, pharmaceuticals, automobiles, and textiles.

articles.title: India's growth resilient despite global challenges: HSBC Mutual Fund
articles.summary: India's economic growth shows resilience amidst global challenges, with domestic factors like declining crude prices and a normal monsoon expected to boost momentum. Despite global uncertainties, a constructive outlook for India's investment cycle is anticipated, driven by government infrastructure spending and a pickup in private investments, particularly in renewable energy.

articles.title: Budget 2026: India needs to breathe new life into its struggling farm backbone
articles.summary: Budget 2026: To pave the way for Viksit Bharat, a transformative surge in India's agricultural sector is crucial. The forthcoming budget should prioritize substantial funding for farming initiatives and innovative research. Implementing strategic reforms can significantly boost farmer productivity and incomes. Additionally, fostering growth in agri-allied businesses, processing, and exports will stimulate rural economies and bridge economic gaps.

articles.title: Iran unrest hits Indian basmati rice exports, industry body says
articles.summary: Iran's upheaval is having a ripple effect on India's basmati rice trade, leading to delayed payments and uncertainty for exporters. As a result, domestic prices of basmati have plummeted. To navigate these turbulent waters, the Indian Rice Exporters Federation is advocating for cautious measures and exploring diversification strategies.

articles.title: View: India has 7.4% growth, but where are the taxes?
articles.summary: Budget: Should the govt play to the gallery of domestic equity investors by lunging for growth? Or should it choose fiscal restraint to keep a lid on rising borrowing costs — both for itself and the private sector? There are no easy answers.

articles.title: MAGA deal in making: US resumes trade talks with ‘real friend’ India
articles.summary: US Ambassador designate Sergio Gor announced that trade pact discussions with India will resume Tuesday, aiming to resolve differences beyond tariffs. He emphasised the strong personal relationship between Trump and Modi, highlighting the partnership's significance beyond trade, encompassing security, technology, and energy cooperation.

articles.title: US tariff pressures push British Columbia to boost India trade
articles.summary: Canadian province's premier David Eby, who is leading a trade mission to India from January 12-17, told ET in an interview that the province is trying to develop more opportunities with India to diversify trade, which has been hit by the US tariffs.

articles.title: Net direct tax mopup rises 8.8% till January 11
articles.summary: Despite a slower pace of tax refunds, the growth in collection was much below the budgeted 12.7% increase for the entire 2025-26. With less than three months left in this fiscal, experts are cautiously optimistic about meeting the budget target of ₹25.20 lakh crore.

articles.title: Retail inflation hits 3-month high of 1.3% in December
articles.summary: In December 2025, retail inflation climbed to 1.3%, rising from November's 0.7%, setting a new three-month peak. While this increase remains shy of the central bank's goal, the easing of food deflation contrasted with the uptick in prices for various goods.

articles.title: Centre earmarks Rs 5,925 crore for coal, lignite exploration from FY27
articles.summary: The investment will be channeled through the Central Sector Scheme (CSS) of coal and lignite exploration.

articles.title: Germany's Merz in India: Amid American squeeze, Europe steps in
articles.summary: India is strategically reorienting its partnerships towards the European Union as U.S. trade faces increasing tariffs. Germany's Chancellor's visit highlights this shift, with a potential EU free trade agreement and growing defense cooperation signaling a comprehensive, structural realignment in India's foreign economic policy.

articles.title: Wheat sowing up 2 pc to 334.17 lakh hectares till Jan 9 of current rabi season: Govt
articles.summary: Wheat sowing has increased by 2 percent to 334.17 lakh hectares as of January 9. This rise in acreage for the rabi season is attributed to better monsoon rains and higher minimum support prices. Other rabi crops like paddy, pulses, Shri Anna, coarse cereals, and oilseeds have also seen increased sowing areas. Overall rabi crop coverage has reached 644.

articles.title: Net direct tax collection grows 8.82% to Rs 18.38 lakh crore till January 11
articles.summary: India's net direct tax collections have seen a significant increase of 8.82%, reaching Rs 18.38 lakh crore between April 1 and January 11. This growth encompasses both corporate and non-corporate tax contributions. Notably, total refunds issued during this period saw a substantial decrease of 16.92% compared to the previous year.

articles.title: Rapid digitalisation of banks reshaping financial risks, requires supervisors to fundamentally rethink: RBI DG
articles.summary: Speaking at the Third Annual Global Conference of the College of Supervisors in Mumbai, RBI Deputy Governor Swaminathan J said that traditional indicators such as capital adequacy and liquidity are no longer sufficient to assess the health of banks in a technology-driven environment.

articles.title: BMI forecasts 7% growth for India in FY27
articles.summary: India's economy is set for strong growth. BMI forecasts 7.4 per cent expansion for the current fiscal year and 7 per cent for FY27. Favourable policies and recent reforms are expected to boost investment and consumption. This positive outlook is supported by strong GDP estimates and rising exports. The foundation for continued economic progress is firmly in place.

articles.title: India’s retail inflation quickens for second straight month to 1.33% in December
articles.summary: India's retail inflation rose to 1.33% in December 2025, driven by increased costs in personal care, vegetables, meat, fish, eggs, spices, and pulses. Despite this uptick, inflation remained below the RBI's 4% target for the eleventh consecutive month. Food prices saw a reduced decline, with vegetable deflation easing.

articles.title: Growing inequality is the top economic concern for youth worldwide: WEF survey
articles.summary: A new World Economic Forum survey reveals that global youth identify growing inequality as their top economic concern. Many are also eager to enter politics rather than just critique, with over a third considering running for office. Climate change remains a defining global worry, even amidst personal financial anxieties.

articles.title: Donald Trump tries to break the Fed. What the clash means for India
articles.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell revealed the Justice Department served subpoenas threatening criminal indictment over his Senate testimony, which he calls a "pretext" to pressure the Fed on interest rates. President Trump denied knowledge but criticized Powell, escalating a conflict over central bank independence and monetary policy.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Trump tariffs or not, trade power should stay with India
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: A 1985 Plaza Accord saw global powers coordinate to devalue the dollar, impacting Japan severely. Today, similar economic conditions and Donald Trump's protectionist policies are reshaping global trade. India, historically less integrated, may find an unexpected advantage in this shift towards self-sufficiency, potentially mitigating direct trade shocks.

articles.title: 'Protectionism hurts us both': Merz pushes for deeper India-Germany security ties as trade tops $50 billion
articles.summary: During his landmark trip to India, German Chancellor Friedrich Merz engaged in productive discussions with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The trade relationship has soared, surpassing fifty billion dollars, as both leaders sealed pivotal agreements focused on technology, defense, and renewable energy sources. Together, they tackled pressing global challenges and emphasised the importance of fortifying their security collaboration.

articles.title: Trump, Modi are ‘real friends’, says US ambassador Gor as India-US gear up for January 13 trade talks
articles.summary: With the inauguration of US Ambassador Sergio Gor in New Delhi, a new chapter in India-US relations begins. His mission highlights the deep-rooted friendship shared by both nations. Ongoing trade dialogues promise fruitful outcomes, with the next round of negotiations set to occur shortly.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Sitharaman & Co will be counting every rupee on the road to Viksit Bharat 2047
articles.summary: Budget 2026 approaches with India's fiscal calculations under scrutiny as tax collections have slowed, impacting government finances. The Finance Minister faces the challenge of maintaining fiscal consolidation amidst these pressures. Balancing growth with discipline will be key. Non-tax revenues and spending discipline are crucial. Market borrowing tolerance is also a significant consideration.

articles.title: Acquisition financing by Indian banks to sanctions risk, 2026 set to be a learning year for India Inc
articles.summary: In 2026, Indian enterprises are bracing for a transformative regulatory landscape, emphasizing toughness and adherence. Financial institutions are now empowered to support acquisitions, while private equity blossoms with the rise of secondary funds. However, the looming threat of sanctions remains a critical concern.

articles.title: Europe fills diplomatic agenda for India this week
articles.summary: Europe takes center stage in Indian diplomacy this week. German Chancellor Friedrich Merz visits Monday, seeking trade expansion before the EU free trade agreement. France's Emmanuel Bonne arrives Monday and Tuesday, preparing for President Macron's February trip. Poland's foreign minister Radosław Sikorski follows. Prime Minister Modi meets Merz in Ahmedabad to boost cooperation.

articles.title: Budget 2026: As economy holds firm, India Inc urges focus on growth, capex and private investment
articles.summary: Businesses in India are urging the government to prioritize economic growth in the upcoming budget. They are calling for more reforms and increased government spending on infrastructure. Incentives for private investment and privatization are also key demands. Support for exporters facing challenges from US tariffs is crucial. The budget is expected to outline the path for future economic expansion.

articles.title: Credit demand zooms as policy eases, outstanding bank credit crossed Rs 200 lakh cr for the first time on Dec 31, 2025
articles.summary: India's credit demand is surging. Lower taxes and supportive monetary policy are fueling investment. Outstanding bank credit has crossed a major milestone. This growth surpasses projections, indicating a strong economic rebound. Auto loans, small and mid-sized companies, and home loans are key drivers. Investment intentions are translating into spending, creating a positive environment.

articles.title: Budget 2026: CII seeks rolling, 3-year pipeline for privatisation
articles.summary: Budget FY26 expectations: The Confederation of Indian Industry suggests a three-year plan for selling stakes in government companies. This strategy aims to speed up privatisation. The industry body estimates a significant amount could be raised to fuel development. The proposal includes gauging investor interest first and then prioritising companies.

articles.title: State capex loans cross 56% of FY26 target by Jan 5; Centre aims for full utilisation
articles.summary: The Centre has released over ₹83,000 crore to states for capital investment. This is part of the special assistance scheme for capital investment. The government is confident of fully utilizing the allocation by the fiscal year end. The scheme provides interest-free loans to states for capital expenditure.

articles.title: JPMorgan Chase shares dip after profits rise 9% in Q4 excluding hit from the Apple Card acquisition
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase said Tuesday that its fourth-quarter profits rose 9% on an adjusted basis, as the bank continues to benefit broadly from a strong economy in both its consumer and investment banking divisions.

articles.title: Market Trading Guide: PVR Inox among 4 stock recommendations for Wednesday
articles.summary: Indian markets turned cautious on tariff concerns and are expected to consolidate in a narrow range. Analysts recommend Oil India, MRPL, Thyrocare and PVR Inox, citing bullish reversal patterns, improving momentum and favourable technical indicators for short-term gains.

articles.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Wednesday
articles.summary: Indian equities ended lower after a sharp intraday reversal, as global trade concerns, rising crude prices, weak rupee, FII outflows and cautious earnings outlook erased early gains despite supportive inflation data and resilient small-cap performance.

articles.title: Wall Street expects strong fourth-quarter earnings driven by robust US economy
articles.summary: Global brokerages expect Corporate America to deliver a strong ‍fourth-quarter earnings season, driven by ​a broadening of profit growth across industries ⁠as the U.S. economy remains resilient.

articles.title: Wall Street CEOs back Fed independence as Trump administration probes Powell
articles.summary: CEOs from top ​Wall Street banks JPMorgan Chase and BNY voiced support for the independence of ⁠the U.S. Federal Reserve on Tuesday, days after the Trump administration opened a criminal investigation into Fed Chair Jerome Powell.

articles.title: S&P 500, Nasdaq steady after mixed results from JPMorgan, Delta Air
articles.summary: US markets opened steady on Tuesday. Inflation data supported expectations of interest rate cuts this year. Investors reviewed mixed quarterly results from JPMorgan and Delta Air Lines. Small-cap stocks saw renewed interest, driven by artificial intelligence optimism and strong earnings forecasts. The energy sector also gained as oil prices surged.

articles.title: ICICI Lombard posts lower quarterly profit as commissions, employee costs rise
articles.summary: India's ICICI Lombard ​General Insurance reported a decline in third-quarter profit on Tuesday, ⁠as higher payouts to agents and employees outweighed strong demand in retail health and motor insurance.

articles.title: Tata Elxsi Q3 profit falls 45% on one-time labour code charge
articles.summary: Indian engineering research and development (ER D) firm ‍Tata Elxsi reported a ​45.3% drop in third-quarter profit on ⁠Tuesday, primarily due to a one-time charge tied to the country's new labour codes.

articles.title: Rs 1071 crore IPO gets Rs 1.1 lakh crore bids: Bharat Coking Coal creates history with 90 lakh applications
articles.summary: Bharat Coking Coal’s IPO drew record-breaking demand, with subscriptions nearing 147 times amid volatile markets, driven by scarcity value, strategic importance to steelmaking, reasonable valuation and confidence in its dominant, monopoly-like position.

articles.title: Bank of Maharashtra reports 26% YoY jump in profit to Rs 1,779 crore
articles.summary: Bank of Maharashtra posted a 26% rise in Q3 profit, supported by strong loan growth and improved asset quality. The lender declared a 10% interim dividend, maintained a healthy NIM, and reported robust corporate loan demand, with advances and deposits continuing to expand at a steady pace.

articles.title: Valuation Watch: 10 large-cap stocks with sky-high PE ratios
articles.summary: Several NSE large-cap stocks trade at extremely high P/E ratios above 75, reflecting strong growth expectations but also raising concerns over valuation risks, speculative buying and the need to assess fundamentals, earnings sustainability and broader market conditions carefully.

articles.title: India bonds fall after Bloomberg index entry setback
articles.summary: Indian government ‍bonds declined on Tuesday, as ​Bloomberg Index Services held off including Indian debt in ⁠its global index, surprising traders as they had already factored it into prices, and added that the review for inclusion was open and ongoing.

articles.title: M3M to invest Rs 3,500 cr to build 'ELIE SAAB' branded housing projects in NCR
articles.summary: Realty firm M3M India on Tuesday said it has partnered with global fashion and lifestyle brand ELIE SAAB to develop two ultra-luxury housing projects in Delhi-NCR with a total investment of Rs 3,500 crore.

articles.title: 2026 to beat 2025 for stocks: Nilesh Shah sees FII comeback, new winners
articles.summary: Indian equities could stage a strong comeback in 2026 after a weak 2025, says Envision Capital Managing Director CEO of Nilesh Shah. He expects FII inflows to return, earnings to improve and new-age digital platforms, financials and healthcare to lead gains, while large IT remains a selective, bottom-up investment story for investors.

articles.title: Retail equity trading slows as SIPs, commodities hit new highs in December
articles.summary: Retail equity trading slowed in December 2025, while SIP inflows and commodity market volumes hit record highs. Motilal Oswal notes that stable mutual fund flows, strong IPO activity and rising commodities participation continue to support India’s capital market ecosystem.

articles.title: GA-Backed Acko said to seek banks for $350 million India IPO
articles.summary: Indian digital insurer Acko Technology Services Pvt. has invited pitches from investment banks for a potential initial public offering to raise as much as $350 million, according to people familiar with the matter.

articles.title: Bank of Maharashtra Q3 Results: Net profit rises 26.5% YoY to Rs 1,779 crore, NII jumps 16%
articles.summary: Bank of Maharashtra posted a 26.5% year-on-year rise in Q3FY26 net profit to ₹1,779 crore, supported by strong operating performance and better asset quality. Net interest income grew 16.3% to ₹7,344 crore, while return on assets improved to 1.86%.

articles.title: Rupee slips, likely intervention cushions pressure from weak stocks, Asia FX
articles.summary: The Indian rupee ‍closed modestly weaker on Tuesday, ​weighed down by a fall in local stocks and regional ⁠currencies, while likely intervention by the central bank limited the currency's decline.

articles.title: Markets turn cautious as Nifty slips into bearish zone; Oil India a buy, go short on L&T: Vinay Rajani
articles.summary: Indian equity markets remain under pressure as Nifty struggles below key resistance levels, with technical indicators signalling a continued bearish trend. HDFC Securities’ Vinay Rajani advises caution, highlights crucial support and resistance zones, and flags selective trading opportunities, recommending a buy on Oil India and a short call on L T amid ongoing market volatility.

articles.title: Reliance Industries shares slip 2%, down 8% in 2026. Time to buy before Q3?
articles.summary: Reliance Industries shares have seen a decline of over 8% in early 2026, reaching an intraday low of Rs 1,448. Technical analysts suggest this is a healthy consolidation within an uptrend, with strong support expected around Rs 1,380-1,440. Investors with a medium-to-long-term view may consider buying on dips.

articles.title: L&T shares drop over 4% even as co clarifies rumors of potential cancellation of Kuwait oil projects
articles.summary: Larsen Toubro shares fell after reports said that Kuwait may cancel oil project tenders worth $8.7 billion. The decline followed news that Kuwait Oil Company is reviewing its capital expenditure after bids exceeded budget estimates, putting major tenders—where L T was the lowest bidder for over $4.5 billion—at risk.

articles.title: Biocon QIP to ease balance sheet pressure; metals, PSU banks favoured in near term: Nischal Maheshwari
articles.summary: Biocon's fundraising is viewed positively to manage debt. Expert Nischal Maheshwari is optimistic about Biocon's future, expecting earlier investments to yield returns. He also favors contract development and manufacturing firms like Laurus Labs. Maheshwari sees potential in banking, metals, and power sectors, particularly execution-focused players in power.

articles.title: Mukul Agrawal’s newest stock bet is up 10% in just 2 sessions. Do you own?
articles.summary: Despite pressure on smallcap stocks for most of 2025, Agrawal’s portfolio featured five multibagger names during the year, namely– Oseal Devices, Zelio E-Mobility, Monolithisch India, Zota Health Care, and ASM Technologies.

articles.title: Earnings better than expected, but IT sector still lacks growth visibility: Sandip Agarwal
articles.summary: India's top IT firms have started their earnings season with results slightly better than expected. Companies like TCS and HCL Tech are managing costs and benefiting from currency movements. However, underlying business growth remains slow. Experts suggest that while current performance is acceptable, significant demand revival is not yet visible.

articles.title: TCS management says strategic investments to continue across key growth pillars
articles.summary: Tata Consultancy Services maintained its EBIT margin at 25.2% in the December quarter. This stability was achieved despite significant exceptional costs. Management highlighted productivity gains and operational efficiencies as key drivers. The company continues to invest in AI and future-ready skills. Workforce optimisation efforts are ongoing. TCS remains focused on long-term strategic priorities.

articles.title: Rs 3 lakh crore wipeout! Sensex sheds over 900 pts from day’s peak, Nifty sinks 1%.  5 factors behind market decline
articles.summary: Indian equities slipped on Tuesday after a brief morning rally, with benchmarks giving up early gains and wiping significant market value. Selling pressure was fueled by profit-taking in heavyweights, rising crude prices, foreign fund outflows, rupee weakness, and fragile technical momentum, leaving investors cautious amid persistent volatility.

articles.title: PMS Tracker: Quant, fintech strategies lead December gains of up to 8%; Kotak, Aequitas among top performers
articles.summary: Quant, fintech and diversified PMS strategies topped December’s charts with gains of up to 8%, even as several small-cap and thematic portfolios saw steep declines. The month underscored sharp dispersion in India’s PMS market, with systematic and sector-focused approaches outperforming while small-cap strategies faced significant selling pressure.

articles.title: Amagi Media Labs IPO Day 1: Subscribed just 4% in early hours. Check GMP and other key details
articles.summary: Amagi Media Labs’ IPO opened to a muted response on Day 1, with overall subscription at just 4% in early trade. A modest grey market premium reflects cautious investor sentiment amid volatile markets and heightened scrutiny of tech valuations.

articles.title: Is silver at its peak?  Robert Kiyosaki explains why he’s not selling
articles.summary: Renowned investor Robert Kiyosaki cautions silver enthusiasts, suggesting the metal might be nearing a short-term peak. He anticipates a significant dip before any further price surge, advising patience. Kiyosaki, who has held silver since 1965, plans to continue buying up to $100, viewing current retail selling as potentially market-damaging.

articles.title: AI-led deal momentum improving; clients spend where ROI is visible: TCS management
articles.summary: TCS management says client demand is improving gradually, with spending focused on projects delivering clear ROI. AI-led deals are accelerating across sectors, with most large clients already engaged. The company expects momentum to sustain into Q4, says margins will be protected through delivery efficiency, and remains cautiously optimistic on FY26 revenue growth.

articles.title: CLSA flags margin recovery ahead for HDFC Bank, predicts 27% headroom despite weak start to the year
articles.summary: CLSA has reiterated its “Outperform” rating on HDFC Bank, setting a target price of ₹1,200 and implying over 27% upside from current levels despite recent stock weakness. The brokerage views concerns over deposit growth and margins as temporary and expects FY27 to be a bounce-back year.

articles.title: Buy or sell? What TCS, HCL Tech results mean for IT stocks after Rs 75,000 crore FII selloff
articles.summary: TCS posts mixed Q3 with margins under pressure, while HCL Technologies beats expectations with AI-driven growth. Sector sentiment is cautious after Rs 75,000-crore FII selloff, with brokerages suggesting stock-specific execution and AI traction will guide performance.

articles.title: Digital Real Estate: India’s REIT market still nascent, but long-term growth potential remains significant
articles.summary: India’s REIT market remains in its early stages, with REITs accounting for just 19% of listed real estate value versus the global average of 57%. Yet this gap signals strong long-term potential, driven by office assets, emerging retail and industrial REITs, and policy support, including SM-REITs, Vestian noted.

articles.title: Heavy Crude, Heavy Consequences: Why Venezuela’s shock tests Canada’s oil economy
articles.summary: A U.S. operation in Caracas and plans to assume control of Venezuela’s oil assets have revived heavy crude flows, posing a direct competitive threat to Canada. With U.S. refineries suited to Venezuelan grades, Canada risks losing market share, pressuring oil revenues and weighing on the Canadian dollar.

articles.title: Standing His Ground: Why Jerome Powell’s latest move marks a turning point
articles.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell is now openly confronting President Trump's criticism. This marks a significant shift as Powell defends the central bank's independence. Recent actions suggest a growing concern over political pressure. Powell's stance is seen as crucial for the institution's autonomy. This period will define his legacy as a central banker.

articles.title: NLC India shares gain 3% as board approves subsidiary listing, interim dividend
articles.summary: NLC India's shares surged following board approvals for its renewable energy arm's listing and a 36% interim dividend. The company plans to dilute up to 25% equity in NLC India Renewables Limited, aligning with national monetization goals.

articles.title: India bonds fall, reversing gears on Bloomberg index disappointment
articles.summary: Indian government bonds experienced a downturn Tuesday after Bloomberg Index Services postponed their inclusion in a global index, citing an ongoing review. This decision dashed market expectations of significant foreign inflows, impacting bond yields. Meanwhile, state debt auctions and a significant dollar-rupee swap by the RBI are also on the horizon, amidst broader geopolitical concerns.

articles.title: Meesho’s 129% post-IPO rally fizzles as stock slides 35% from peak amid valuation concerns. Buy, sell or hold?
articles.summary: Meesho’s sharp post-IPO rally has lost momentum as valuation concerns, lock-in expiry-related selling and cautious brokerage commentary weigh on the stock. While analysts flag limited near-term upside, the company’s strong user base, improving logistics efficiency, and differentiated e-commerce model continue to underpin its long-term business prospects.

articles.title: Microsoft says will foot AI's massive power bill
articles.summary: Microsoft said Tuesday it will shoulder the full electricity costs of its US data centers to prevent American households from facing higher power bills driven by surging AI energy demand. "I never want Americans to pay higher Electricity bills because of Data Centers," Trump wrote.

articles.title: How AI 'deepfakes' became Elon Musk's latest scandal
articles.summary: Elon Musk's company xAI has faced global backlash in recent days over sexualised "deepfake" images of women and children created by its Grok chatbot. Indonesia on Saturday became the first country to block access to Grok entirely, with neighbouring Malaysia following on Sunday. India said Sunday that X had removed thousands of posts and hundreds of user accounts in response to its complaints.

articles.title: Israel says $450 million invested in local VCs to support tech innovation
articles.summary: Around $450 million in public and private money has ‍been invested in nearly ​a dozen Israeli venture capital funds under a programme ⁠aimed at sustaining technology investment during a slowdown in VC markets, a government body said on Tuesday

articles.title: Onebrief raises $200 million at a valuation of $2 billion
articles.summary: A military startup Onebrief has secured a funding of $200 million. This investment values the company at over $2 billion. Onebrief has also acquired Battle Road Digital, a company specialising in defense gaming and simulation technology.

articles.title: Misochain Tech raises Rs 18 crore in funding led by Capital A
articles.summary: Aerospace deeptech company Misochain Technologies has raised Rs 18 crore in a funding round led by Capital-A, a venture fund for manufacturing and deeptech, a release said.

articles.title: Illumina launches dataset to speed up AI-powered drug discovery
articles.summary: Illumina has introduced a new dataset to speed up drug discovery using artificial intelligence. This initiative involves major drugmakers like AstraZeneca, Merck, and Eli Lilly. The dataset will train advanced AI models to understand diseases better. This development aligns with efforts to reduce animal testing. Companies are increasingly using AI for faster and cheaper drug development.

articles.title: Seattle Consulate hosts event on India's expanding AI ecosystem ahead of Delhi Summit
articles.summary: The Consulate General of India in Seattle co-hosted a special event providing an overview of the country's expanding AI ecosystem and its evolution, ahead of the global AI summit to be hosted in New Delhi next month.

articles.title: AI education dialogue calls for urgent rethink of learning systems in AI era
articles.summary: Held at Jio Institute, Navi Mumbai, the half-day roundtable brought together more than 50 leaders from philanthropy, edtech firms, academia and the private sector as an official pre-summit event of the India AI Impact Summit 2026, the organisers said in a press release.

articles.title: Sarvam AI and Tamil Nadu govt to establish sovereign AI park
articles.summary: Tamil Nadu has partnered with Sarvam AI to establish a Rs 10,000 crore Sovereign AI Park, aiming to create 1,000 deep-tech jobs. This initiative will build an independent AI ecosystem within the state, fostering local talent and ensuring data sovereignty.

articles.title: Spain moves to curb AI deepfakes, tighten consent rules on images
articles.summary: Spain's government has approved a new bill to combat AI deepfakes. The legislation will strengthen child protection and set 16 as the minimum age for image consent. It also limits the unauthorised use of AI-generated images and voices for commercial purposes. European Union nations are also moving to criminalise non-consensual sexual deepfakes by 2027.

articles.title: Voice AI startup Deepgram raises $130 million at $1.3 billion valuation
articles.summary: Voice AI startup Deepgram has secured $130 million in funding, valuing the company at $1.3 billion. This investment will fuel international expansion into Europe and Asia-Pacific. Deepgram also plans to develop new AI models and pursue strategic acquisitions.

articles.title: End of Q-Comm's 10-min era; Google meets Siri

articles.title: Quantum software company Haiqu raises $11 million
articles.summary: Haiqu, a quantum software startup, has secured $11 million in funding. The company aims to make quantum computing more accessible by reducing costs and improving hardware performance for larger applications.

articles.title: Malaysia to take legal action against X, xAI over Grok concerns
articles.summary: The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) already suspended access to Grok, which is integrated into both the X and xAI platforms, on Sunday. It has now appointed solicitors to commence "legal proceedings" against X and xAI, the regulatory body said, without specifying what form the proceedings would take.

articles.title: Liquidnitro Games raises $19 million from Northpoint Capital, Nexus
articles.summary: The fresh capital will be used to scale the Hyderabad-based company’s AI-enabled game production and live services platform, expand its global operating footprint, and back co-investments with publishing partners, cofounder Sandeep Kowdley told ET in an interaction.

articles.title: Deeptech company Greentech raises Rs 30 crore from Transition VC
articles.summary: The company manages OEM-agnostic multi-brand wind assets and provides full-scope O M, predictive maintenance, data analytics, SCADA modernisation, component repairs and crane-less major component exchanges.

articles.title: Actress Samantha Prabhu’s perfume brand Secret Alchemist secures $3 million from Unilever Ventures, others
articles.summary: The round was a mix of primary and secondary capital. Of the total amount, $2.5 million was primary capital and the remainder was secondary, with a few early angel investors selling their stakes, cofounder Akash Valia told ET. The company plans to use the capital for branding and marketing, to widen its product portfolio, and expand the team.

articles.title: Why Apple has called on Google to help smarten up Siri and bring other AI features to the iPhone
articles.summary: The deal allowing Apple to tinto Google's AI technology was disclosed Monday in a joint statement from the Silicon Valley powerhouses. The partnership will draw upon Google's Gemini technology to customize a suite of AI features dubbed "Apple Intelligence" on the iPhone and other products.
